body_html:
It looks like you haven't configure/linked in XLA JIT support for your binary. The XLA_CPU JIT device isn't registered, so the placer can't assign the matmul op there.

I assume you're following the instructions here: https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/experimental/xla/jit ?

Note: TensorFlow must be compiled from source to include XLA.

Did you enable XLA as part of the ./configure process?
(see https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/configure#L234)
body_text:
It looks like you haven't configure/linked in XLA JIT support for your binary.  The XLA_CPU  JIT device isn't registered, so the placer can't assign the matmul op there.
I assume you're following the instructions here: https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/experimental/xla/jit ?

Note: TensorFlow must be compiled from source to include XLA.

Did you enable XLA as part of the ./configure process?
(see https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/configure#L234)
body:
It looks like you haven't configure/linked in XLA JIT support for your binary.  The XLA_CPU  JIT device isn't registered, so the placer can't assign the matmul op there.

I assume you're following the instructions here: https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/experimental/xla/jit ?

> `Note: TensorFlow must be compiled from source to include XLA.`

Did you enable XLA as part of the `./configure` process?
(see https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/configure#L234)
